info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 21 at 7:04PM CDT until June 21 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT FOR EASTERN ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHWESTERN DONLEY COUNTIES... At 704 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles northwest of Brice, or 13 miles southwest of Clarendon, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Clarendon, Greenbelt Lake and Goodnight. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
